net.jordaria.entity

Class Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jordaria.entity.Direction

  • public class Direction
extends java.lang.Object
    An angle from one to 360 which contains methods for modifying the angle.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      float angle 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Direction(float degrees)
      Constructs a new Direction with the given angle.

      Adds the specified amount to the angle.

      Returns the angle as a float.

    • Field Detail

      • angle

        public float angle

    • Constructor Detail

      • Direction

        public Direction(float degrees)
        Constructs a new Direction with the given angle. If the angle is outside the allowed range, it is set to an equivalent value inside the range.
        Parameters:
        degrees - The angle in degrees. Decimals are allowed.

    • Method Detail

      • getAngle

        public float getAngle()
        Returns the angle as a float.
        Returns:
        The current angle

      • addAngle

        public void addAngle(float amount)
        Adds the specified amount to the angle. If the new angle is more than 360, it wraps around back past zero so it is in the allowed range.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to increase the angle by in degrees. Decimals are allowed.

      • subtractAngle

        public void subtractAngle(float amount)
        Subtracts the specified amount to the angle. If the new angle is less than 0, it wraps around back past 360 so it is in the allowed range.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to decrease the angle by in degrees. Decimals are allowed.

      • getRelativeDirection

        public Direction getRelativeDirection(Direction offset)
        Combines the two directions to form a new direction. The new direction has an angle equal to this one and the offset added together and confined to the allowed range of angles.
        Parameters:
        offset - The direction to offset this one by
        Returns:
        A new direction with the offset angle
